intro: Metteniusa tessmanniana, commonly known as the Tessmann's metteniusa, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid forest environments. Its leaves are usually elliptical and glossy, with a moderate size, and it produces fragrant, white to pale yellow blooms. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
